parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions "candidates" participating in the parliamentary elections and refers to their controversial statements and actions. While it doesn't name specific candidates, it directly relates to individuals running for office.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is presented as a news article targeting a broad audience interested in the Romanian parliamentary elections. The reach estimate of 500K-1M further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While presented as a news article, the post highlights negative aspects of certain candidates' behavior and statements. This could potentially influence voters' choices by creating a negative perception of those candidates. The title itself is sensationalist and designed to attract attention.  The use of strong language ("Prințeso, sugi p***!") is highly provocative and unlikely to be used in neutral reporting. The overall tone and selection of information suggest an intention to influence voters, even if indirectly.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post is formatted like a news article, but the selection of information and the sensationalist title raise questions about its objectivity. The focus on negative aspects of candidates' behavior, without providing a balanced perspective, suggests a potential bias. The use of inflammatory language further undermines its journalistic integrity.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it presents information in a manner designed to shape public perception of candidates. The inflammatory language and focus on negative aspects suggest an attempt to influence voters' choices.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>587821263743282</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while presented as a news article, exhibits characteristics of electoral propaganda.  It targets the parliamentary elections, directly referencing candidates and their actions. The sensationalist title and inflammatory language are designed to attract attention and potentially influence voters' opinions negatively towards certain candidates. Although it doesn't explicitly endorse or oppose any specific candidate, the selective presentation of negative information and the overall tone strongly suggest an intention to sway public opinion. The fact that it's a paid advertisement on a public platform further strengthens this interpretation.  The counter-argument is that it's a news article, but the lack of objectivity and the use of inflammatory language weaken this defense.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>info-sud-est.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Info Sud-Est, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID 587821263743282), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu conținut ce constituie propagandă electorală,  având ca efect influențarea negativă a opiniei publice asupra unor candidați la alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, deși prezentată sub forma unui articol de știri, utilizează un limbaj inflamator și selectiv, concentrându-se pe aspecte negative ale comportamentului unor candidați, fără a oferi o perspectivă echilibrată. Titlul senzaționalist și utilizarea unor expresii jignitoare ("Prințeso, sugi p***!") demonstrează intenția de a influența votul.  Campania a avut o estimare a razei de 500.000 - 1.000.000 de persoane, cu cheltuieli sub 100 RON, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Contact: redactia@info-sud-est.ro, +40740134925.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
